commitmsg:
Replace newtype wrappers around cubeb enums.

Newtype idiom introduced incompatibility when passing/returning via FFI.
cubeb-pulse-rs: Update Cargo.toml to generate rust and c static lib.
Update README.md to add build status badge for dev
Bring up-to-date with kinetiknz/cubeb 087dc94

Apply changes from cubeb 17503c4 - Pulse layout assert (#291)

* pulse: create pa stream with default layout

Merge pull request #6 from djg/move-logging-to-own-module

Move logging to own module
logging: Extract from ffi.rs to log.rs.

travis: Use rustup to install the i686 cross target. (#5)

* travis: Use rustup to install the i686 cross target.

This is easier to understand than using the external wrapper
script, with everything defined in-tree. We lose the hack
around doc-tests not working with cross-compilation, however.

Define TARGET and FEATURES only if they are different
from the defaults. Use rustup to install the alternate
target support. Use posix shell parameter expansion to
prefix the --target and --features cargo switches if the
corresponding variables are set.

Use folded blocks to improve formatting. The '>' prefix
character folds the subsequent indented block into a single
string with newlines removed. This lets us add and remove
switches cleanly without long lines or continuation. Note
however that the whole block must use the same indentation.

Remove some keys which just declared default values.
Merge branch 'dev'

Merge pull request #3 from djg/ci-setup

Configure Travis CI.

Configure Travis CI.

Build 32-bit/64-bit x static-link/dynamic-link
README.md: Add Travis build status badge.

Cargo.toml: Remove default feature as it causes headaches.

Too many issues with static-link vs. dynamic-link.  Remove default and
static-link and just base decision upon dynamic-link feature to pulse-ffi.

Merge pull request #1 from djg/dev

Port cubeb_pulse.c to rust

Stream: Fix 32-bit compilation issues.

Replace i64 cast with c_long cast.

Context: configure dynamic loading of libpulse.

Initialize FFI functions before creation of Context.
Cleanup #[derive] attributes.

Clippy all the code!

Implement code improvement suggestions from clippy.
Rustfmt all the code!

stream_read_callback: Convert stm to *mut.

stm is mutable and not const, so `stm as *const _ as *mut _` should be
`stm as *mut _ to *mut _` to convert to a *mut c_void via type
deduction.
stream_write_callback: Remove redundant assert on stm.input_stream.
stream.rs: Enable all commented LOG calls.
Stream::latency: Don't assert negative before checking return code.
Move PA_USEC_PER_MSEC, PA_USEC_PER_SEC to pulse-ffi crate.
subscribe_success: Nest inside register_device_collection_changed.
sink_info_callback: Nest inside server_info_callback.
Use ptr::null_mut() instead of 0 cast.
PA_RATE_MAX: Move to pulse-ffi crate.
make all functions exposed to cubeb C ops tables unsafe.
Replace *i8 with *c_char in FFI.

Convert licensing comments to ISC-style.

Source files now match LICENSE file.
Eliminate destroy! macro.
ChannelMap: Default initialize to zero size and invalid values.
Remove empty file, destroy.rs
Fix DataCallback to use c_long instead of i64.
Convert DeviceType to use bitflags macro.
Convert DevicePref to use bitflags macro.
Convert DeviceFmt to use bitflags macro.
User ptr::null_mut() instead of 0 cast.
Remove cubeb-pulse-rs dependency upon libc.
Remove libpulse-sys crate.

Switch out libpulse-sys for pulse-ffi.

pulse-ffi has a better license and allows for dynamic loading for
pulse.so.

Convert enums to new_type ints.

Update makes constants look more like the Cubeb C API.

eg: cubeb::SAMPLE_S16LE instead of CUBEB_SAMPLE_S16LE.
Review: Consistently format macro parameters.
Review: Remove commented g_log_callback example.

Review: Replace the use of libc with std::os::raw.

Removes dependency upon libc for c types.

Review: Specify explicit libc version.

Set to ^0.2.20 to match version used in gecko.
Review: Pulse Audio -> PulseAudio

Bug 1332887: return state enabled with port is NULL.

Merge from kinetiknz/cubeb #224.

Implement version checking for functions that require it.

In cubeb_pulse.c, the header file that is being compiled against is
checked for version.  Because that is unavailable through the ffi
bindings for pulse instead use pa_get_library_version() which returns
the version of libpulse that is linked against at runtime.
Add AUTHORS file.

Add LICENSE

Use the same license as Cubeb, which this code is derived from.
Create README.md
Include local version of libpulse-sys that supports dyld fns.
Initial version of cubeb_pulse.c converted to rust.

FFI bindings for cubeb.

Generated via rust-bindgen and then handcrafted.
Initial repo setup
Point build badge to build action.
Remove obsolete CI config.
Add build action.
Remove cubeb_stream_reset_default_device API.
Use the input data ring buffer to count input frames read.
Add missing pa_stream_get_name support for `pulse-dlopen` feature.
Add method to change stream name

Remove initial playback latency when full duplex (#59)

* Remove initial playback latency when full duplex

This is in case the input fill the ringbuffer too much before the output
is initialized and read it.

* Added trim function and decreased input_frame_count value

* Fixed rust syntax error

* Condition and comment change

Co-authored-by: Corentin ARNOULD <corentin.arn@gmail.com>

Added input_latency code to backend/stream.rs (#57)

* Added input_latency code

It is similar to latency code defined just above in the file.
Also fixed some formating.

* Fixed negative buffer latency panic

I tested wrong, pulse can return negative latencies, but here is a patch

* Input latency return 0 when negative

* Add description for negative input latency case

Co-authored-by: Corentin ARNOULD <corentin.arn@gmail.com>
Add an empty (for now) method for input_latency, and bump the cubeb version

Merge pull request #55 from achronop/revert-volume-fix

Revert "Disable server-side volume handling."

Revert "Disable server-side volume handling."

This reverts commit e845327c3fe91192870a34fc2999d2f460291295.

Implement devices change logic.

Set DONT_MOVE in input and output device if device id is specified or the CUBEB_STREAM_PREF_DISABLE_DEVICE_SWITCHING is set.

Disable server-side volume handling.

The API from pulseaudio is not coming, and this is causing user pain. We
can resurrect this code when we have an API to do what we want to do.
Fix warning
Update ringbuf to 0.2
Add the license to Cargo.toml
Update semver to 0.9

backend: Special case single channel center mapping to mono.

Addresses BMO 1582442.

update the info when default device changes

Import the fix for: https://github.com/kinetiknz/cubeb/issues/545
Fix deprecated `try!` warnings for rustc nightly 1.40.
Update semver to 0.7
Update to cubeb-rs 0.6.0; remove panning API.

Tweak pa_buffer_attr according to Ford_Prefect's recommendations.

irc.mozilla.org#media, 2019/07/05, CEST

```
11:43 <padenot>      Ford_Prefect, I'm also experimenting with various
                     setttings for the buffer_attr here
                     https://searchfox.org/mozilla-central/rev/b9041f813de0a05bf6de95a145d4e25004499517/media/libcubeb/cubeb-pulse-rs/src/backend/stream.rs#946
11:44 <padenot>      I see conflicting information: Chrome's code seem to
                     work well and does something, but the docs say
                     something else
11:55 <Ford_Prefect> padenot: what values?
11:55 <padenot>      the 5 values to put in pa_buffer_attr for input and output
11:56 <padenot>      see this comment https://cs.chromium.org/chromium/src/media/audio/pulse/pulse_util.cc?type=cs&q=pa_buffer_Attr&g=0&l=480
12:09 <Ford_Prefect> padenot: huh, that seems to have changed since the
                     last time I saw it. minreq = tlength / 4 is good,
                     particularly for smaller values
12:11 <Ford_Prefect> I'm not sure why Chrome is doing * 3, they should
                     be okay with * 2 (so minreq will be buffer_size / 4)
12:11 <Ford_Prefect> er, tlength
12:12 <Ford_Prefect> I've never been able to come up with a good
                     works-for-everything heuristic on the PA side,
                     hence this divide-by-4 thumb rule
```

Revert "Revert "Use std::mem::MaybeUninit instead of the deprecated std::mem::uninitialized""

This reverts commit a32febf6c3ec1b57e5a34bb2dd28bcbc8ffd961f.
Use the correct number of samples in the input buffer ringbuffer pull operation.

Run the PulseAudio callbacks from the output

This is lots of code, but it's not particularly complex. Instead of
driving the callbacks from the input events, this drives them using the
output event.

For this to work, the input data delivered to the program are queued
into a lock-free ringbuffer. Then, when there is a need for output data,
PulseAudio calls its callback, and we put the data from the ring buffer
into a linear piece of memory, and call the callback as usual.

All the complexity and duplication is because we support f32 and i16
really.
Make pa_sample_size available in Rust.
Bump minimum Rust version to 1.35 to match Gecko beta version requirement.

Revert "Use std::mem::MaybeUninit instead of the deprecated std::mem::uninitialized"

This reverts commit 9d1c1292a11cf90f9450a97a1aa4604849263c45 to unblock
landing PR #42.  Landing this change in Gecko isn't possible yet (bug
1563877) as there's still a minimum requirement on rustc 1.35.

Use std::mem::MaybeUninit instead of the deprecated std::mem::uninitialized

See https://gankro.github.io/blah/initialize-me-maybe/

Gecko now uses 1.36: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1563378

Use assert_eq instead of debug_assert_eq for safety-critical assertions.

Generic methods are monomorphized,
so for each given instance `size_of::<CB>()` is a constant.
The assertion can therefore be optimized away
by constant propagation and dead code elimination.

Set default layout when it is not configured (BMO 1518106). (#40)

Set default layout when it is not configured (BMO 1518106).
Separate input output callbacks for collection changes (BMO 1498242).

Log rather than assert unsuccessful stream/context callbacks.

Fix for BMO bug 1471922.

Use fully-qualified syntax for USecExt::to_bytes.

This addresses BMO #1472001, where we fail to build with Rust nightly
because USecExt::to_bytes implemented on USec (which is a type alias of
u64, not a newtype) is ambiguous when nightly stdlib's u64::to_bytes is
present.
Mark PulseContext and PulseStream #[repr(C)] to ensure ABI compatibility with libcubeb.

Fix cubeb channel layout to pulse channel map.

Turns out that the clever C code I copied was incorrect.  So changed
it to the rust idiom of iterating the bits in the bit set via
Iterator.  Added copious tests so not to get burned if, in the future,
this layout changes.
Update versions due to change in cubeb channel layout and mixer.

Remove the concept of preferred layout.

Channel layout is derived by the content being played. The concept of
preferred layout is meaningless. Either we have a layout defined, or
we don't. There's no in-between.

So we remove it.

Check Context::connect result.

This applies the same fix made in kinetiknz/cubeb#425.

Handle error in pa_context_get_server_info.

This addresses Gecko Bug 1438414, where `debug_assert_ne!(i,
ptr::null_mut())` fires in callback for `Context::get_server_info`.

From reading the PulseAudio source code, this happens in a few error
cases such as command timeout.
Reformat all the code to rust standard.
Update to use cubeb-rs 0.4.

Refactor to use cubeb-rs for FFI.

Remove the use of local copy of cubeb FFI bindings to use the shared
code in cubeb-rs crates.
Fix Travis CI 32-bit builds.

Handle stream preferences and loopback requests.

https://github.com/kinetiknz/cubeb/pull/387 introduced a preferences member on
the stream params struct. This updates the backend to handle that member. This
also makes the backend return the appropriate not supported error should the
new prefs be used to request a loopback stream, as the backend does not
currently support loopback streams.
Fix clippy suggestions.
avoid deadlock when context subscribe fails

Update to bitflags 1.0

The 1.0 version uses associated constants instead of module constants.
Fix a few unused mut warnings on newer Rust compilers
Fomat log message in rust code

Improve handling when there are no pulse source/sink.

Port of kinetik/cubeb PR #360.

Merge pull request #19 from djg/fix-travis-ci

travis-ci: Add missing glib 2.0 dev dep.
travis-ci: Add missing glib 2.0 dev dep.
Remove assertion when pulse has no sinks configured.
backend: Add test for Intern.
backend: Add (crude) string interning to provide stable devids.
context: Treat DeviceType as a bitfield.
Fix unused macro warning for cstr!.
cubeb-pulse-rs: Updates required by changes to Stream::get_latency().

pulse-rs: Stream::get_latency return StreamLatency enum.

Instead of returning tuple (u64, bool) where if bool is true
translates to a negative latency, the latency is returned via variant
enum where Positive and Negative makes the distinction explicit.
stream: Fix !negative assert in latency().
Add cubeb_stream_reset_default_device to synchronize the changes of Cubeb

Upstream gecko Bug 1375873.
Upstream gecko Bug 1376000.
Make turning ptr T into Option<T> safer.

cubeb-pulse-rs: Remove panic from pulse_format_to_cubeb_format

Return F32NE like cubeb_pulse.c

pulse-rs: Remove shift checks in flag validation.

Replace the use of shift with and and-with-mask to check only valid
flag bits are set.

pulse-rs: Change PropList interface to take rust strings.

... and perform the allocation to convert to CString internally.
Remove cstr! macro.
pulse-rs: Replace implicit unref with explicit unref.

pulse-rs: Replace nullable Stream with Option<Stream>

In discussion with :kinetik it was decided to use more idiomatic
Rust. Instead of being able to hold a Stream that might be invalid,
use Option<Stream> to signal when a valid Stream is held.

cubeb-pulse-rs: Clean up trigger_user_callback parameters.

Turns out stream pointer to trigger_user_callback was only ever
self.output_stream.

pulse-rs: Replace nullable Context with Option<Context>

In discussion with :kinetik it was decided to use more idiomatic
Rust. Instead of being able to hold a Context that might be invalid,
use Option<Context> to signal when a valid Context is held.
Remove unused pulse::{Context, Stream}::clone()
pulse::Stream::drop_record -> pulse::Stream::drop
Macro-fy error checking and returning Operation boilerplate.
Remove unused fn write_with_free.
Remove early return from position() so not to skip unlock.
Add comment that is_good() fns must match PulseAudio macros.
Add note about wrapped functions in callbacks.
Reinstate assert that get_latency result is non-negative.
cubeb-pulse-rs: Remove rr comment.
cubeb-rs: Make ThreadedMainloop::signal implicitly not wait.
pulse-rs: Change ThreadedMainloop::Start to return Result<()>.
clippy fixes.
pulse-rs: Changes to support extension traits.
cubeb-pulse-rs: Cleanup unsafe { } calls with extension traits.
cubeb-pulse-rs: Convert pa_stream to pulse::Stream.
pulse-rs: Changes for pulse::Stream.
pulse-ffi: Changes for pulse::Stream.

pulse-rs: Changes needed for pulse::Context, pulse::Operation, etc.
pulse-ffi: Changes for pulse::Context, pulse::Operation, etc.

pulse-rs: Changes needed for pulse::threaded_mainloop.

De-duplication of code: state_from_sink_port and
